channel.title: Competitive Coding on suresh sarda
channel.description: Recent content in Competitive Coding on suresh sarda

item.title: Solution to Leetcode - Happy Number
item.description: As part of 30 days challenge during the Corono pandemic, Leetcode published this problem on the second day: A happy number is a number defined by the following process: Starting with any positive integer, replace the number by the sum of the squares of its digits, and repeat the process until the number equals 1 (where it will stay), or it loops endlessly in a cycle which does not include 1.

item.title: Hackerrank - maximum-draw solution
item.description: Solution to HackerRank question: maximum draw Explanation This one is really simple. The question is: Jim is off to a party and is searching for a matching pair of socks. His drawer is filled with socks, each pair of a different color. In its worst case scenario, how many socks (x) should Jim remove from his drawer until he finds a matching pair? So Jim keeps removing socks from drawer, and the moment he finds a pair(repeat color) he stops.

item.title: Hackerrank - find-point solution
item.description: Solution to HackerRank FindPoint Domain Knowledge Required What is a symmetric point? Given 2 points P and Q, a symmetric point of P against Q is such that Q is the midpoint of the line joining P and the symmetric point P’. In other words, let’s say a point P’ is the symmetric point. Then, P-Q-P’are on one line Dist(PQ) = Dist(QP’) Code import java.io.*; import java.util.*; import java.
